description: Detects when a system—government, corporation, or media—uses emotional triggers, reward framing, or controlled language to subtly direct public behavior without informed consent.

variables.S(t): Strategic suggestion (slogans, ad placement, biased defaults)
variables.N(t): Narrative leverage (fear campaigns, hero positioning, guilt messaging)
variables.B(t): Public boundary control (transparency, opt-out, consent signals)

response: Persuasion without boundaries becomes coercion. Healthy systems allow disagreement, choice, and transparency. Reintroduce public awareness and consent layers.
